reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here Friday night instead of getting cabs into the city centre and back.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money with the Right Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paid 39GBP for a room without breakfast - which was excellent value. Room (225) was spacious and clean with tea making facilities, toiletries & trouser press etc. I found the bed to be comfortable and there was no noise throughout the night, so had a very good nights sleep. The staff I found to be friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Dirty, Horrible, Hotel - rude management

reviews.text: Yes, as almost every one has commented - it does need a lot of TLC as it is a wonderful historic Hotel that would benefit from great improvement - Our City would also benefit if this once wonderful building is ever restored to the Shining light it once was.
reviews.title: Friday night stay

reviews.text: Taking into consideration the price paid - The Hotel met our expectations and needs for the night. Only niggle was the long wait for the one lift that was working.
reviews.title: my experience here contradicted the terrible reviews I had read

reviews.text: booked a weekend in a Luxury Room - I have never seen such blatant false advertising
reviews.title: Weekend break

reviews.text: I took a group of 50 here for the weekend from the time I booked this marie hall as been wonderfulll so helpfull, befour we even got there our coach was stuck in traffic on the motterway so we was going to be lategetting there, I spoke to marie & the dinning manger could not be morehelpfull they sorted a later time for my group to have there meal which was hot fresh & lovly they even sorted my veg people, on checking in 50 that is it took no longer than 7 min the young lady was frindly polite, & new what she was doing, our room was very good , I have more complaints about 5 star hotels than i didabout this one infact i never had a compliant, the ood was always hot & fresh & if something was not on there a menber of staff would sort it it was nice to have fresh cold water on the table, the only thing i wouldhave liked to c was a saled bar, yes the lift was a done side,. But for the size of this wonderfull old hotel the whole of the staff worked very hard here, Its a100 years oldsoon & its wonderfull that so much ofit as been kept ,our maid was patie she was a shere joy to talk to & kept our room spotless we were in 104 & it was very comfie, I took my own music group here we had a privte room & even that ws sorted out for me, they are very coach friendly as a orgnizer we have ahard time pleseing every on but here i never had one compliant in fact i had the opp when are we coming back here i had someone in a wheelchair in my group the young man on the desk was great with him, I canot c why people are compling about this hotel like i said ive had 5 stars that a disgraze But there gain some people moan about anything, & it says a lot when 50 people go into a hotel & no compliants we will def be back to this wonderfull old hotel very soon
reviews.title: weekend stay for a group of 50

reviews.text: Location is the only thing it has going for it, it's handy to the City Centre, Cathedrals, Art and History Museums , the Fabulous Beatles Museum, Magical Mystery Tour and tribute band, and Albert Docks. ---Liverpool is a vibrant city a must visit -----------------however.....
reviews.title: Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in desperate need of a make over and staff training, our room had no shower but a large cast iron bath and sink, with faucets you'd expect to find on a Fire tender -- genuine Victorian antiques !! One of the waiter staff ill mannered attitude and severely lacking knowledge doesn't endear your confidence.
reviews.title: Jubilee
National Holiday weekend
reviews.text: We went to celebrate the Queens Diamond Jubilee with a short 3 night stay at the Adelphi Hotel where they were holding a 'Jubilee Ball' which sounded as though it should be a good night of singing and dancing, and also a Beatles Tribute. The central location with a short walk to the shops, renovated dock area and river is very good.
The front of the hotel and foyer is impressive and a lot of the public areas are still very grand with the original marble walls, ballrooms, chandeliers etc. dating back nearly 100 years.
reviews.title: Faded grandeur offset by price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good food, service and downstairs rooms. Entertainment fair, swimming pool ok. Bedrooms used for coach parties need updating but found bedding to be clean and generally acceptable for the price we paid ours being all inclusive and 2 coach trips
reviews.title: Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we read the reviews after booking and were a bit nervous however we didnt need to be .check in was very fast and friendly.we decided to walk up the stairs to our room which was on the 4th floor as only one lift was working the hotel could do with more lifts saw a lot of old people checking in .room was clean and tidy only one negative there was a big waterstain on ceiling but you couldnt see it unless you looked .we had both breakfast and dinner and yes the food was a bit plain but there was plenty and it was hot all the staff we saw and spoke to were friendly so maybe some of the reviewers dont actually take the time to be polite to them would stay at this hotel again if in liverpool .also if any of the amateur boxing teams parents are reading this they did you proud we heard no noise from them and if you were stood next to them they were very polite ypoung men
reviews.title: good exercise going to rooms

reviews.text: This hotel is situated right near the railway station, (only a few minutes walk) on entering the hotel it looked very grand. Check-in was very quick and smooth, staff was friendly. However the room and bathrooms where very old and in need of redecorating. We was only bed and breakfast, and the breakfast was lovely plenty to choose from. we was a 10 min walk to mathew street where all the good pubs and club was.( To come home by taxi from there was £5 )
reviews.title: great locatation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean,if a little dated.Staff were always helpful.Biggest problem is the lifts.You can wait 15 minutes for one,and then it is full.There always seems to be one out of order.The breakfast choice is excellent,but the evening meal is a little restricted.Saying that,the food available is good quality.Location for shops & bars is excellent.
reviews.title: Need a lift

reviews.text: My daughter and myself stay here on a regular basis when shopping, we now prefer Liverpool to London for a girly shopping session. I love the faded grandeur of this once Titanic era type hotel. Considering what we pay I wouldn,t grumble about standards, however we never eat in the hotel the food is tasteless and bland, We usually pop to the pizza shop over road and eat it in our room.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were in bed after not long being awake when a housekeeper just came right in without knocking on any door! We even had a do not disturb sign on the door! I was disgusted. When I rang reception to complain they just passed me onto housekeeping,they said they would go and 'have a word with her'. I am more upset that we never received an apology. Paula room 414 22/6/12
reviews.title: COULD NOT BELIEVE THIS HAPPEND

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at this Hotel for a weekend break. We travelled by train and were pleasantly surprised that the Hotel was a short walk from the station. The location was excellent for shopping and eating. The hotel room was clean. A twin room, quite small but sufficed a weekend break. The beds were not very comfortable and were a little lumpy. Our window would not close and our heating did not come on, but having complained at reception, it was dealt with immediately. Overall I would visit this hotel again. Some of the room were quite spectacular downstairs and there seemed to be a lot of weddings taking place.
reviews.title: HOTEL WEEKEND BREAK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 17th - 23rd June 2012, Room 217. Wow! Was our first word on entering the hotel, how could anyone think otherwise, what is the matter with these people that say it should be demolished, the place is a legend...we paid for a superior room and got that and more.. The room was huge, spotlessly clean, ok it was dark wood panelling but that added to the uniqueness to the room, there was plenty light in the room, a huge bed, plenty storage space and a very large bathroom with a jacuzzi, I liked the fact it was on floor two on the corner away from the front door which made it very quiet. We love architecture and this hotel did not disappoint in any way.
reviews.title: Amazing Experience

reviews.text: The only minor in the room was a very small TV which for the size of the room was quite strange but who goes to a fabulous hotel to watch TV.?
reviews.title: faulty towers!!!!

reviews.text: Our mattress was very hard, when we told reception, they changed it to a comfortable one. The reception staff were extremely helpful and curteous at all times, a credit to the hotel.
reviews.title: Awful night!
